metadata.Name: RuSemShift
metadata.Description: RuSemShift is a manually annotated test set for semantic change modeling in Russian, covering pre-Soviet, Soviet, and post-Soviet periods.
Provider: National Research University Higher School of Economics
metadata.Paper Title: RuSemShift: a dataset of historical lexical semantic change in Russian
Affiliations: National Research University Higher School of Economics
metadata.Abstract: We present RuSemShift, a large-scale manually annotated test set for the task of semantic change modeling in Russian for two long-term time period pairs: from the pre-Soviet through the Soviet times and from the Soviet through the post-Soviet times. Target words were annotated by multiple crowd-source workers. The annotation process was organized following the DURel framework and was based on sentence contexts extracted from the Russian National Corpus. Additionally, we report the performance of several distributional approaches on RuSemShift, achieving promising results, which at the same time leave room for other researchers to improve.
